segment.source: Use x:Phase with the {x:Bind} markup extension to render ListView and GridView items incrementally and improve the panning experience.
segment.target: Use x:Phase with the {x:Bind} markup extension to render ListView and GridView items incrementally and improve the panning experience.

segment.source: x:Phase attribute'
segment.target: x:Phase attribute'

segment.source: x:Phase attribute
segment.target: x:Phase attribute

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Use x:Phase with the {x:Bind} markup extension to render ListView and GridView items incrementally and improve the panning experience.
segment.target: Use x:Phase with the {x:Bind} markup extension to render ListView and GridView items incrementally and improve the panning experience.

segment.source: x:Phase provides a declarative way of achieving the same effect as using the ContainerContentChanging event to manually control the rendering of list items.
segment.target: x:Phase provides a declarative way of achieving the same effect as using the ContainerContentChanging event to manually control the rendering of list items.

segment.source: Also see Update ListView and GridView items incrementally.
segment.target: Also see Update ListView and GridView items incrementally.

segment.source: XAML attribute usage
segment.target: XAML attribute usage

segment.source: XAML values
segment.target: XAML values

segment.source: Term
segment.target: Term

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: PhaseValue
segment.target: PhaseValue

segment.source: A number that indicates the phase in which the element will be processed.
segment.target: A number that indicates the phase in which the element will be processed.

segment.source: The default is 0.
segment.target: The default is 0.

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: If a list is panned fast with touch, or using the mouse wheel, then depending on the complexity of the data template, the list may not be able to render items fast enough to keep up with the speed of scrolling.
segment.target: If a list is panned fast with touch, or using the mouse wheel, then depending on the complexity of the data template, the list may not be able to render items fast enough to keep up with the speed of scrolling.

segment.source: This is particularly true for a portable device with a power-efficient CPU such as a phone or a tablet.
segment.target: This is particularly true for a portable device with a power-efficient CPU such as a phone or a tablet.

segment.source: Phasing enables incremental rendering of the data template so that the contents can be prioritized, and the most important elements rendered first.
segment.target: Phasing enables incremental rendering of the data template so that the contents can be prioritized, and the most important elements rendered first.

segment.source: This enables the list to show some content for each item if panning fast, and will render more elements of each template as time permits.
segment.target: This enables the list to show some content for each item if panning fast, and will render more elements of each template as time permits.

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: The data template describes 4 phases:
segment.target: The data template describes 4 phases:

segment.source: Presents the DisplayName text block.
segment.target: Presents the DisplayName text block.

segment.source: All controls without a phase specified will be implicitly considered to be part of phase 0.
segment.target: All controls without a phase specified will be implicitly considered to be part of phase 0.

segment.source: Shows the prettyDate text block.
segment.target: Shows the prettyDate text block.

segment.source: Shows the prettyFileSize and prettyImageSize text blocks.
segment.target: Shows the prettyFileSize and prettyImageSize text blocks.

segment.source: Shows the image.
segment.target: Shows the image.

segment.source: Phasing is a feature of {x:Bind} that works with controls derived from ListViewBase and that incrementally processes the item template for data binding.
segment.target: Phasing is a feature of {x:Bind} that works with controls derived from ListViewBase and that incrementally processes the item template for data binding.

segment.source: When rendering list items, ListViewBase renders a single phase for all items in the view before moving onto the next phase.
segment.target: When rendering list items, ListViewBase renders a single phase for all items in the view before moving onto the next phase.

segment.source: The rendering work is performed in time-sliced batches so that as the list is scrolled, the work required can be re-assessed, and not performed for items that are no longer visible.
segment.target: The rendering work is performed in time-sliced batches so that as the list is scrolled, the work required can be re-assessed, and not performed for items that are no longer visible.

segment.source: The x:Phase attribute can be specified on any element in a data template that uses {x:Bind}.
segment.target: The x:Phase attribute can be specified on any element in a data template that uses {x:Bind}.

segment.source: When an element has a phase other than 0, the element will be hidden from view (via Opacity, not Visibility) until that phase is processed and bindings are updated.
segment.target: When an element has a phase other than 0, the element will be hidden from view (via Opacity, not Visibility) until that phase is processed and bindings are updated.

segment.source: When a ListViewBase-derived control is scrolled, it will recycle the item templates from items that are no longer on screen to render the newly visible items.
segment.target: When a ListViewBase-derived control is scrolled, it will recycle the item templates from items that are no longer on screen to render the newly visible items.

segment.source: UI elements within the template will retain their old values until they are data-bound again.
segment.target: UI elements within the template will retain their old values until they are data-bound again.

segment.source: Phasing causes that data-binding step to be delayed, and therefore phasing needs to hide the UI elements in case they are stale.
segment.target: Phasing causes that data-binding step to be delayed, and therefore phasing needs to hide the UI elements in case they are stale.

segment.source: Each UI element may have only one phase specified.
segment.target: Each UI element may have only one phase specified.

segment.source: If so, that will apply to all bindings on the element.
segment.target: If so, that will apply to all bindings on the element.

segment.source: If a phase is not specified, phase 0 is assumed.
segment.target: If a phase is not specified, phase 0 is assumed.

segment.source: Phase numbers do not need to be contiguous and are the same as the value of ContainerContentChangingEventArgs.Phase.
segment.target: Phase numbers do not need to be contiguous and are the same as the value of ContainerContentChangingEventArgs.Phase.

segment.source: The ContainerContentChanging event will be raised for each phase before the x:Phase bindings are processed.
segment.target: The ContainerContentChanging event will be raised for each phase before the x:Phase bindings are processed.

segment.source: Phasing only affects {x:Bind} bindings, not {Binding} bindings.
segment.target: Phasing only affects {x:Bind} bindings, not {Binding} bindings.

segment.source: Phasing will only apply when the item template is rendered using a control that is aware of phasing.
segment.target: Phasing will only apply when the item template is rendered using a control that is aware of phasing.

segment.source: For Windows 10, that means ListView and GridView.
segment.target: For Windows 10, that means ListView and GridView.

segment.source: Phasing will not apply to data templates used in other item controls, or for other scenarios such as ContentTemplate or Hub sections—in those cases, all the UI elements will be data bound at once.
segment.target: Phasing will not apply to data templates used in other item controls, or for other scenarios such as ContentTemplate or Hub sections—in those cases, all the UI elements will be data bound at once.
